timeline.bodyText: Since you are passing this to the superclass constructor, why not have a superclass manage the lifecycle of this variable? CryptographyAsyncClient can have a protected method getKeyId() to get this key id.
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
This needs to be Public API only in KEK client.
So moved the variable management to super class as package private method.
Kept it public in KEK client.
replies.author: g2vinay

timeline.bodyText: Why doesn't this constructor initializeCryptoClients() while the other constructor does (line 95)?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
In other constructor, JWK key is passed into the constructor. Key is available to initialize crypto clients.
While in this constructor only key id is available at constructor time. In this scenario the Key gets fetched from the service and crypto clients are initialized on demand when user invokes a crypto operation on the client.
replies.author: g2vinay
